import MethodEndpoint from "@theme/ApiExplorer/MethodEndpoint";
import ParamsDetails from "@theme/ParamsDetails";

<Heading
  as={"h1"}
  className={"openapi__heading"}
  children={"Get asset status type"}
>
</Heading>

<MethodEndpoint
  method={"get"}
  path={"/api/v1.0/assets/status/types/{assetStatusTypeId}"}
  context={"endpoint"}
>
  
</MethodEndpoint>



Retrieves metadata for a specific asset status such as "In Storage" or "In Service".

**Prerequisites**
1. **assetStatusTypeId** - Use [GET /api/v1.0/assets/status/types](/docs/api/assets/list-asset-status-types) to list all status types and extract `Items[].AssetStatusTypeId`.

**Workflow Example**
1. List status types: [GET /api/v1.0/assets/status/types](/docs/api/assets/list-asset-status-types) to retrieve available definitions.
2. Extract the `AssetStatusTypeId` for the desired status.
3. Call [GET /api/v1.0/assets/status/types/\{assetStatusTypeId\}](/docs/api/assets/get-asset-status-type) for full details.

**Minimal Required Fields**: assetStatusTypeId (path).

<Heading
  id={"request"}
  as={"h2"}
  className={"openapi-tabs__heading"}
  children={"Request"}
>
</Heading>

<ParamsDetails
  parameters={[{"name":"assetStatusTypeId","in":"path","required":true,"description":"UUID of the status definition to retrieve. Obtain from asset records (`Status.AssetStatusTypeId`) or spare pool search results.","example":"83a10b14-c3a9-4f3b-b104-da83276f9101","schema":{"type":"string","format":"uuid"}}]}
>
  
</ParamsDetails>

<RequestSchema
  title={"Body"}
  body={undefined}
